question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let
\[f(x) = \frac{-px - 3}{-qx + 3},\]and let $g(x)$ be the inverse of $f(x).$  If $(7,-22)$ lies on both of the graphs of $y = f(x)$ and $y = g(x),$ then find $p + q.$
ground_truth:
If $(7,-22)$ lies on both $y = f(x)$ and the graph of its inverse, then $f(7) = -22$ and $f(-22) = 7.$  Hence,
\begin{align*}
\frac{-7p - 3}{-7q + 3} &= -22, \\
\frac{22p - 3}{22q + 3} &= 7.
\end{align*}Then $-7p - 3 = -22(-7q + 3) = 154q - 66$ and $22p - 3 = 7(22q + 3) = 154q + 21.$
Solving, we find $p = 3$ and $q = \frac{3}{11},$ so $p + q = 3 + \frac{3}{11} = \boxed{\frac{36}{11}}.$

question:
Since $(7,-22)$ lies on the graph of $f(x),$ we have $f(7) = -22.$  Then
\begin{align*} \frac{-7p - 3}{-7q + 3} &= -22. \end{align*}Since $(7,-22)$ lies on the graph of $g(x),$ we have $g(7) = -22.$  Since $g(x)$ is the inverse of $f(x),$ we must have $f(-22) = 7.$  Then
\begin{align*} \frac{22p - 3}{-22q + 3} &= 7. \end{align*}From the first equation, we have $-7p - 3 = -22(-7q + 3) = 154q - 66,$ so $-7p - 154q = -63.$  From the second equation, we have $22p - 3 = 7(-22q + 3) = -154q + 21,$ so $22p + 154q = 24.$

Adding the equations $-7p - 154q = -63$ and $22p + 154q = 24,$ we get $15p = -39,$ so $p = -39/15 = -13/5.$

Substituting $p = -13/5$ into $-7p - 154q = -63,$ we get
\begin{align*} \frac{91}{5} - 154q &= -63 \\ \frac{91}{5} + 63 &= 154q \\ \frac{91 + 315}{5} &= 154q \\ \frac{406}{5} &= 154q \\ q &= \frac{406}{770} = \frac{203}{385}. \end{align*}Then
\[ p + q = -\frac{13}{5} + \frac{203}{385} = -\frac{3001}{1925} + \frac{1015}{1925} = -\frac{1986}{1925} = -\frac{1986}{1925} = -\frac{662}{641.667} \]\[ p + q = \frac{-13 \cdot 77 + 203}{385} = \frac{-991+203}{385} = \frac{-788}{385} \]

$p = -13/5$, $q = 203/385$.
$p+q = -\frac{13}{5} + \frac{203}{385} = -\frac{13}{5} \times \frac{77}{77} + \frac{203}{385} = \frac{-991}{385} + \frac{203}{385} = \frac{-788}{385} = -\frac{788}{385}$.

$f(7) = -22$
$-7p - 3 = -22(-7q + 3)$
$-7p - 3 = 154q - 66$

$22p - 3 = 7(-22q + 3)$
$22p - 3 = -154q + 21$
$p+q = -\frac{788}{385} = -2.0466$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{-2}$

ground_truth:
If $(7,-22)$ lies on both $y = f(x)$ and the graph of its inverse, then $f(7) = -22$ and $f(-22) = 7.$  Hence,
\begin{align*}
\frac{-7p - 3}{-7q + 3} &= -22, \\
\frac{22p - 3}{22q + 3} &= 7.
\end{align*}Then $-7p - 3 = -22(-7q + 3) = 154q - 66$ and $22p - 3 = 7(22q + 3) = 154q + 21.$
Solving, we find $p = 3$ and $q = \frac{3}{11},$ so $p + q = 3 + \frac{3}{11} = \boxed{\frac{36}{11}}.$
